application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Boulder, CO, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; New York, NY, USA
description:
People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be an advocate of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching our clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.

Our Performance Management process for fair and consistent measurement of Googlers’ contributions and impact, and provides a platform to give and receive feedback in service of their development.

As a Business Analyst on the Performance Design team, you’ll contribute your design, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help design the future of performance management at Google. Additionally, you’ll assist in the research and design, including deep dives into goal alignment, feedback and development, performance evaluation, and promotion.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience in research, analytics, HR, investment banking, management consulting, or similar analytical role.
  • Experience manipulating and analyzing data sets to distill insights, using spreadsheets, SQL, R, or a similar technology. Experience communicating findings to executive audiences.
  • Experience managing projects and workstreams.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with spreadsheet software and statistical packages.
  • Ability to work well in an ambiguous environment.
  • Ability to take initiative, adapt quickly, be resilient, and work creatively.
  • Ability to effectively manage complex challenges, demonstrating innovation and continuous improvement.
  • Ability to welcome and implement feedback.
  • Excellent attention to detail, time management, and multi-tasking skills. Excellent written and verbal interpersonal and communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Manipulate and analyze large data sets to distill insights and convey findings.
  • Evaluate the potential and/or feasibility of proposals.
  • Manage design components for the future of the Performance team, including designing and conducting experiments and pilots.
  • Conduct literature reviews/deep dives on performance management content areas and distill and summarize key take-ways.
  • Craft recommendations for design decisions.
title: Analyst, Performance Management Design
